javax.jaxtx.compensation
Interface CompensationParticipantManager

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public interface CompensationParticipantManager
extends java.io.Serializable

When a Compensation Transaction participant registers with a transaction it may get a reference to a service that lets it callback into the transaction and drive any state-transitions for itself. This reference may represent the same endpoint as the CompensationTransaction or may be an entirely separate service. There is one instance of this interface per compensation participant. Implementations of this interface are required to be serializable such that they may be used in the event of failure and subsequent recovery. How a given implementation ensures that a serializable transaction instance is rebound upon recovery is beyond the scope of this specification.

Version:
1.0 $Id: CompensationParticipantManager.java,v 1.1 2004/06/22 10:07:58 nmcl Exp $

Method Summary
 void completed()
          The participant has completed its work and is ready for the transaction to terminate.
 void exited()
          The participant wants to remove itself from the compensation transaction.
 int recover()
          A participant or recovery service acting on its behalf, may enquire as to the recovery status of the transaction.
 

Method Detail

exited

public void exited()
            throws WrongStateException,
                   UnknownCompensationTransactionException,
                   UnknownParticipantException,
                   SystemException
The participant wants to remove itself from the compensation transaction. This may be equivalent to using the delist operation on the corresponding compensation transaction.

Throws:
WrongStateException - thrown if the transaction is no longer in a state where exiting is allowed.
UnknownCompensationTransactionException - thrown if the system no longer has record about the transaction.
UnknownParticipantException - thrown if the system does not know about this participant.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

completed

public void completed()
               throws WrongStateException,
                      UnknownCompensationTransactionException,
                      UnknownParticipantException,
                      SystemException
The participant has completed its work and is ready for the transaction to terminate.

Throws:
WrongStateException - thrown if the transaction is not in a state where completion is possible.
UnknownCompensationTransactionException - thrown if the system no longer has record about the transaction.
UnknownParticipantException - thrown if the system does not know about this participant.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.

recover

public int recover()
            throws UnknownCompensationTransactionException,
                   SystemException
A participant or recovery service acting on its behalf, may enquire as to the recovery status of the transaction. If recovery is necessary and has not been instigated on behalf of this participant, then this invocation may institute the recovery process.

Returns:
the current status of the transaction. The participant may use this to optimize its own recovery processes.
Throws:
UnknownCompensationTransactionException - thrown if the system no longer has record about the transaction.
SystemException - thrown if some other error occurs.
See Also:
Status
